website_summaries.verdict: The JLab Fit is an accessory-packed, sonically pleasing budget earphone option—ideal for those of you who burn through multiple pairs a year and need affordable replacements.
pros: Solid audio performance for price, with laudable bass response, well defined high-mids
Includes remote control and microphone for use with mobile devices
Includes plenty of eartip options, two detachable cables
cons: Some minor distortion on deep bass at top volumes
Detachable cables do not disconnect at earpiece, so some of the cabling is permanent

customer_reviews.title: they sound great! She usually breaks the wire right above the ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my daughter (she tends to go through a set per month), but I tried them out since hers are still working. I just might have to keep them, they sound great! She usually breaks the wire right above the plug, and you can replace the lower part of the cord on these. I got these on sale (I can't afford to buy $30 earphones!), so sound AND build quality are better than on "cheap" earphones. And by the way, their promised delivery date was the 15th - 20th, and they got here on the 14th. Pretty shiny all the way around...
customer_reviews.author: AmraLeo

customer_reviews.title: but I've had better success molding it first
customer_reviews.text: These are the only earplugs I've had that actually work for my ears. Comes with lots of earbud options, as well as two lengths of cords. The microphone works for phone calls. The instructions say to mold it around your ear, but I've had better success molding it first, then trying it on, and then adjusting through trial and error. Since the product is moldable, it will get squished out of the shape you molded it to if you leave it in a backpack pocket. Wearing a good, molded fit might tire your ears. You won't feel it until you take them off.
customer_reviews.author: BZ

customer_reviews.title: Over engineered junk - would be Zero stars if possible
customer_reviews.text: Wish I hadn't purchased these ear buds. I'll stick to the simple single piece runner headphones on the market. This product is poorly designed, overly engineered, and the base ear bud set up consists of 3 pieces. There are also an additional 10 to 15 pieces consisting of varying ear bud sizes, small plastic clips, and other general parts that all equal a frustrating and confusing product experience. I just want a simple set of headphones, that don't take half an hour to figure out how make them comfortably fit. My loss of $20, their future loss of me as a customer since I will never buy another JLAB branded product again.
customer_reviews.author: Safety Conscious Parent

customer_reviews.title: Can't answer phone calls
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good but I've only used these a couple times so far (not in water or anything like that) and discovered the button for answering calls or turning off music doesn't work--can't answer a phone call. Kind of the whole reason I got these over just a pair of plain headphones is I want to be able to take a call. JLAB site register page doesn't have a SUBMIT button so I could register for warranty or refund, but sent them a message so we will see what happens. I want to like these, but not a happy customer at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: E. Cunia

customer_reviews.title: Sweatproof really works!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for only a few weeks, but so far they are excellent! I go through ear buds like crazy because I sweat a lot during my workouts. This is the first pair I have owned that have not shorted out on me in the first weeks of usage. They stay on great, though I've had to adjust getting used to the fit around my ears. I like them a lot! The sound quality is awesome too! If they last more than a few months, then they are the best ear buds ever. Time will tell. So far I love them!
customer_reviews.author: M. Clover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fit sport earbuds sound excellent! The construction is solid. But...I've purchased and replaced at least 5 different sets of earbuds by JLab and the quality of sound and construction is always solid. But I've replaced and purchased this many sets because they never last more than a year. Sometimes, they last 3 months and JLab gladly replaces them. Sometimes they last just over a year and oops, I need another pair! I believe the manufacturers are playing games with us and we are happily playing along!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie L. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but...
customer_reviews.text: These come with so many gadgets and doolies, but I can't get them to stay in my ears when I run. I think the wire part that is supposed to conform to your ear is too stiff (maybe). I spend a bunch of time shaping it, and then as soon as I start running, it starts to sneak out and eventually fall out. I tried to use them just as normal earbuds, but they hurt in that configuration. They are a great price though. Sound quality is comparable to the $50 sonys.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Not Really Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have a set of JLab ear buds that I absolutely. So, when I was in the market to replace my running buds, I immediately turned to them. The ear buds were a major disappointment. First off, they don't stay in the ear. I couldn't get the moldable ear piece to retain its shape. The first time I used them, running a half marathon, the left side crapped out about 3 miles into the run. I bought a cheap pair of JVC ones that sounded just as good and are more durable...at a 1/3 of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Duped Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I messed with the "earhooks" for two weeks and I was finally able to make them stay on my ears. It has been extremely difficult to shape these things. You're better off just buying earbuds with the preshaped hooks because while these sound good, I almost threw them away because I can't get them to fit. When I say I got them to stay on my ears, I mean they are physically on my ears but I still cannot make good contact with my ear canal to get a good seal for better sound
customer_reviews.author: mexican1

customer_reviews.title: earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear during my morning runs and they are great! The wire, around the ear part is definitely a little tricky to get it to properly fit nicely but, really you only need to figure it out once and then not bend them again. These are especially nice with the microphone, because I often have to take calls while out on my runs and everyone can hear me very clearly and it saves me the hassle of having to quickly get me phone out and holding it till the conversation is done. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Its good if you want to make your headphones longer or ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize these came from my old stomping grounds of O-side until they came in the mail. For $10 they are worth every penny. The pro/con is the connector mid line. Its good if you want to make your headphones longer or shorter, but that connector makes the line heavier. So you can't run with your cable outside your clothes. The bounce is too much, but if you run it under your shirt it works just fine. Sound quality is fine for the price. Now the test is how long they last
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bad fit and one side quit working
customer_reviews.text: Bought these two weeks ago and they looked very promising. Seemed to fit OK at first then after a few runs they were constantly falling out. Then today one side just quit in the middle of my run. They have a one year warranty and they are sending a new pair but I am not sure they will be any better fitting. When they are in the ear and fit they sound pretty good but the constant adjusting sucks. Two stars for the prompt service and sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: CSP

customer_reviews.title: Really just awful
customer_reviews.text: 1) They broke the third time I used them — the left earbud just stopped working. 2) The wire ear hooks don't work so well, as it takes several minutes to get them to fit securely around your ear each time you put them on 3) The sound quality just isn't that great, it's worse than the basic earbuds that come with an iPhone, for example. You should probably steer clear of these.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: stopping working after 6 months of occasionaly use. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: A nice unique feature I really like about these earbuds is the modular cable to disconnect and reconnect to quickly hide wire under clothing, or move away from charging phone momentarily without disconnecting at phone. controls worked fine, felt cheap, hard to press to skip. okay comfort wise. average sound. never could keep the bend just right around my ears. right ear bud died after 6 months of occasionally to weekly use. I am going to try the Monoprice 109927 earbuds or MEE M6P headphones instead which look like a better value under $20
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly sweatproof: I used them only once jogging and the left earring went kaput. Earbuds tend to fail, I use quite a few of them every year, but usually they last at least two months, those ones not even one day!!! Obviously they tell you about warranty, but sending them back will cost me more than buying new ones, so I just take the loss, but I hope this review will help you not to waste your money as I did....
customer_reviews.author: Alessio Bembo

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones! I really like the different ear buds that it comes with plus the 2 different cords based on how long you want your headphones to be. The bendy cord is an excellent feature by the ear buds because you can bend and mold them to any shape necessary for complete comfort! This is the second pair I have bought because my sister stole the first pair since loved them too! Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Del Re

customer_reviews.title: Not as sweatproof as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband in December to use at the gym. I was hopeful these would be good earbuds for him because he goes to the gym five days a week and sweats a lot and has always had issues with earbuds quitting on him because of that. He liked the sound quality and the fit but unfortunately, he told me last month, March, that they stopped working and can no longer use them. Pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: Everything but the sound is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these except the sound quality. The ear hooks are the most comfortable I've ever used. The flange tip go in and stay in. Cord length is good. The sound, though, is thin. Needs "oomph". Found myself wishing there was a dial to turn up the bass. They require a 2-3 hour burn in. Right out of the box they were awful. By the end of my first 2 hour fast walk with them I thought they would just take a while to get decent sound. Never happened. 10 hours with them now and I'm going shopping. Really a shame as they are by far the most comfortable and stable ear buds I've worn.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Tinny sound, barely any mids/bass
customer_reviews.text: I was intrigued by the design and I frankly was hoping that the sound quality was top-notch. Sadly, it's not. It's very tinny with little to no bass. Even when listening to bass heavy music. Even with the bass boost enabled on my iPod. Unfortunate, because the in-wire adjustability is excellent... and if they sounded at the least "decent", I'd keep them for the fit alone. I'll be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Marino

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother. Expect to continue paying for these throughout their very, very short life-span.
customer_reviews.text: Expect the price to double after you purchase, since you'll spend so much money on shipping the product back the JLAB to get it replaced. True to their word, they were very durable the first and only week that they worked. It only took me 20 minutes to fiddle with the form "fitting" headphones to get them to marginally hang off my ears. Some people have complained about cord length. I had multiple cords, it was fine. But, they don't even stay on when riding a stationary bike, much less anything mobile. Oh well, I can't hear much through them anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Tad Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts to tiny for small ears! But no in-line volume control
customer_reviews.text: The size is highly adjustible, so its great for my tiny ears. There are seven sizes of ear buds, and the small one is extremely little. Perfect. This was my main criteria so I am happy with the ear buds! But, weirdly -- the in-line microphone and control does not have volume control. So odd. I didn't even think to look for that as a product feature because I assumed if there was a microphone and control, it would include volume. Oh well. And iPhone does not allow volume control by voice command, so that's not an option either.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but too much emphasis on mids
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find great sounding IEMs for exercise and I was close with these. While they do sound nice and clear, I find them to be too heavy in the mids. My benchmark for headphones is my Sony MDR-V6. They are a huge PITA to get fitted correctly but once you do, they stay positioned as long as you want and are quite comfortable. Overall, these buds are good but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Had to return them.  Sound unacceptable.  Could be defective.
customer_reviews.text: While the design of these is what I am looking for to use during work outs, the sound was unacceptable. Low level, lots of noise, and no lows/base to be found. I compared these to my Klipsch and there is no comparison. There is a high chance the ones I got are defective. But if yours happen to have the same characteristics as mine chances are this is as good as it gets for these.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri Furman

customer_reviews.title: Was really hoping for a home run on these...strike out...
customer_reviews.text: I had great hopes for these after reading all the reviews and seeing only one pair that died. Mine are evidently number 2. The right ear bud quit working after only a couple weeks of use. Up to this I was reasonably satisfied with the sound quality. I had some issues with getting them to stay in my ears when running but was getting them adjusted then poof the one side died. Not happy...
customer_reviews.author: TJC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I could not get these to stay in my ears. The bendable ear hooks are awkward and heavy, so they pull on the earbuds. They also just look silly. I was trying to use them with a Nexus 5 with the bumper case, but the jack is too big. This is the first set of headphones/earbuds that I've encountered where the jack is too big. I returned these and will look for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great!..until they're not.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were perfect, until they stopped working. I walk a lot with my newborn in an ergo and like to listen to the news and audiobooks. These headphones worked great for about a month and then started shorting. At first I thought it was a positioning issue in my ear but once the second side began shorting as well I realized that it wasn't me, it was the headphones. So other than the 1 month lifespan, I loved these.
customer_reviews.author: KCAmazon

customer_reviews.title: I have a hard time getting them around my ear ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time getting them around my ear. The end that I plug into my phone buts up against my case so it doesn't have a solid connection. There's no clip on the wire to hold on to my clothes so I get tangled up when swinging my arms. The button on the cable is too high up and hard to find when exercising. And lastly, there's no volume control.
customer_reviews.author: NobMor

customer_reviews.title: Earpieces don't really work
customer_reviews.text: These come with instructions for how to bend the earpieces so that they are customized for your ear, but the wires really don't bend correctly - no matter how many times you try to follow the directions, they don't work. You can use the earbuds like regular earbuds, and the quality is ok, but they don't work as described.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds don't stay in
customer_reviews.text: The sound is ok but a lacking in the bass department. My biggest complain is that the ear hooks don't hold the earbuds securely in my ear. I constantly have to readjust because the earbuds gradually slide out of my ear. I've tried all of the earbud sizes and I've tried every ear hook conformation I could think of, but they still slide out.
customer_reviews.author: O U

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, great sound, just too big to fit my Iphone case
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds ... Once you figure out how to fit them right, they rock! The earphone jack for these was too big for my Iphone case, so I had to look for another solution to meet my gym needs... The 3.5 Jack on these is big, beware. I was really hoping that these would meet my needs(and get a higher rating)
customer_reviews.author: Al Gon Quin

customer_reviews.title: Great workout headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few years now to use at the gym mostly. They work great. I've washed and dried them accidentally at least twice by leaving them in my pocket. They still work perfectly. I'll be looking at the JLab Epic Bluetooth headset when I need a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best buds in this price category
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot, and I always leave my earbuds in the wrong bag. I end up buying a lot of earbuds, so I've had a pretty good chance to check out a lot of different brands at this price level. These are the best earbuds at this price, and I'd definitely recommend them. The only fiddly thing is getting them wrapped around your ear and fitted properly. After they are in, though, they are awesome. The sound isn't tinny, the base response is great, and they just sound like more expensive earbuds. Don't get me wrong...they won't compete with a $200 set, but they are the best that you'll find for the money. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 9 days flat
customer_reviews.text: Had out of the box for 9 days. Used for 7 of them. Right earpiece has already shorted out and no longer works. Worked great for about 5 of the days before that ear piece starting coming and going. Hope I had a defective one and a new pair will fix the problem because they were very comfortable and worked great for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay in your ear, despite the multiple ear bud options
customer_reviews.text: Constantly fiddling with them and trying to bend them to see if you can get it right because they just won't stay in your ear. I've tried all the different size options that they come with, but they fall out all the time. Don't even bother trying to run with them, as they're hard enough to keep in your ear walking around the gym. I'm sure the sound quality,is great, but it doesn't make a lot of difference if they won't stay in your ear.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting these to solve all of the headphone problems I've had in my life. They didn't. Finding the right size earbud was impossible to start with. Adjusting the over-the-ear wires was a difficult task. Then, once you finally have them in the magic spot and you are close to workout nirvana, they shift and come out. I would never buy these again as they are just not worth the hassle or money.
customer_reviews.author: Cheston

customer_reviews.title: Broke in < 24 hrs - Ouch
customer_reviews.text: I bought these via some supplier but thru the Amazon website. I broke them in less than 24 hrs. The design is garbage because you have to bend the ear piece around your ear and that bends the wires. $20 flushed. My $1.50 Diaso earbuds work like a champ during and after very hard hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Perry A

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't bother with it and chalked it down to a bad experience. Klipsch with the same issue sent me ...
customer_reviews.text: One ear stopped working. Customer service wanted me to send it to the US from India for return spending more money on shipping than the cost of the product. Just didn't bother with it and chalked it down to a bad experience. Klipsch with the same issue sent me earphones from Canada. That is customer service and why I will always buy from a company which is easier to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: I used these one time and after that the earbud attached to the microphone stopped working. Will try to get a new pair since they are under warrantee, but the way they hook onto your ears is kind of awkward (maybe because my ears are small?) so I don't know if I would even want to use them again.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed they didn't last longer...
customer_reviews.text: I've had two pair of them, as I bought them both within a few months as I recall. Both of them died. I did get over a year out of them, which put them outside the warranty period. One pair's microphone stopped working, and the other pair is completely dead. I used them only to listen to music while I work, no hard use at all. Sound was okay when they did work.
customer_reviews.author: Shane L.

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones
customer_reviews.text: Best sports earphones I have ever owned. I have purchased numerous pairs of these because I use then so much. Lightweight, sweat proof, adjustable and great sound. I run with them almost everyday. I have used them so extensively, I have warn them out but due to my own lack of care and not to quality of product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Glerum

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound, The Bendy Part Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Good sound for the money. The "Sport" feature, the bendy bits, don't really work. Not very flexible and poor materials "memory". That is, you shape it but it doesn't retain the shape. I am using as conventional earphones. OK, but heavy because of those useless bendy parts added weight.
customer_reviews.author: Chi_Guy

customer_reviews.title: The price is great but hard to keep the fit just right while ...
customer_reviews.text: The price is great but hard to keep the fit just right while running. They are okay but hard to keep the foam in just the right position to maintain high fidelity. I have tried twisting the year wires in most every possible position. Could be my ears?
customer_reviews.author: Brer Brown

customer_reviews.title: Broken after limited use
customer_reviews.text: Used them 2 times a week and within the first month the left earbud stopped working. Then the mic went on the fritz. Now 2 months later and the other ear bud is gone. They were comfortable and all but I expected more. I did not get them wet or even sweat in them... Back to my 5 dollar headset...
customer_reviews.author: Marlise D

customer_reviews.title: The sound that comes out of the earphones is good. The probblem is that they don't hold
customer_reviews.text: The sound that comes out of the earphones is good. The probblem is that they don't hold. With just a little bit humidity the earbuds start falling out of the hear and the wire that is suposed to hold the shape arorund your ear looses. Even with just a slight adjustment you loose the sound quality since the earbuds are not in your ear propperly. I would much more recommend static Sports Earbuds to these flexible ones. I haven't tried the mic so I cannot comment that. I wouldn't recomend this product to anyone who is looking for a good earbud to run with. Unfortunatly I wanted to give it a try but have been disapointed by it.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Screw these headphones
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY IT DONT BUY IT DONT BUY IT DONT BUY IT DONT BUY IT DONT BUY IT!.. It worked well for a month and then the right ear stopped working.. I didnt do anything extreme in them they claim to be waterproof but it seems after working out with them for a month it stopped working.. the wires are weak, the sound isnt all that its just not worth the 30 dollars. Just spend another 30 dollars and get something thats worth while.. PLEASE LIKE THIS review so people can know the truth! These headphone are garbage
customer_reviews.author: Jeff the plantain

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: This is undervalued. They work well and cost very little. The sound quality is ok, a bit high frequency but I can adjust my music for that. I use them to bike with. I'm very happy with my earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: michael morris

customer_reviews.title: good idea, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: great idea in theory, but not very practical. i dont like that i have to fiddle with them every time i use them, for them to fit well. Maybe I'd get better at it over time, but i prefer other headsets for casual use and another for workouts
customer_reviews.author: James Chavez

customer_reviews.title: The bendable portion near the buds is a great feature, especially if you plan to use these ...
customer_reviews.text: The bendable portion near the buds is a great feature, especially if you plan to use these to run/workout. The pause/play button on the wire is also a nice touch, especially for such inexpensive headphones. The product also comes with interchangeable wires with different lengths, useful if you keep your music playing device in your front pocket and don't want a lot of wire dangling in front of you. However, mine lasted 2 weeks after using them SPARINGLY. I ran with them once, and used them at the office for 2 days before they stopped working. Seems like it could be a fluke, but again, they're pretty inexpensive headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive headset for workouts
customer_reviews.text: Good versatile inexpensive headset for workouts (running). Sound is a bit tinny, lacking significant bass. OK for background music, but not recommended if you like to damage your eardrums. I liked it enough to buy a second one after about a year (one for home, one for travel bag). Two different length cords for customer configuration, lots of different earbud tips.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V. Mills

customer_reviews.title: I hated these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I hated these headphones. They were difficult to put on and would not stay on when I ran. They would come off every 5 minutes. I just gave them to my little brother to use. Don't buy if you want running headphones. If you just want them to listen to music go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Can't get them to fit
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and the in line controls are nice, also nice are the varying length cords, but I cannot get them to fit. Perhaps if a second person helped but what a hassle. I've gone back to using my original iPod ear phones which hang in the ears. Not as good sound but no trouble to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. L

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound but horrible setup.
customer_reviews.text: I had these packaged for return because of their poor fit quality but forgot to send them back. Frankly, the wear of the earbuds is downright awkward. Its impossible to get them to stay in place. The sound quality is decent but at this price it should be. There are much better fitting alternatives on the market- pass on these.
customer_reviews.author: Centurionpainting

customer_reviews.title: Purchased it for using while I run since it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for using while I run since it is suppose to be sweat proof. Already had to return it for warrenty claim after only a couple weeks of use due to one earbud no longer working. Receiving a new pair that will hopefully last longer.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for jogging and walking after reading reviews. They do not fit well or stay in the ear, even when I'm just sitting down. I wish I had known about Apple earpodes before because they are perfect for me. This was a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: OKC-LOVES AMAZON

customer_reviews.title: I like these because they fit my ear but none of ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these because they fit my ear but none of them have worked longer than a year and they require an adapter with my lifeproof case where as the regular iPhone ear buds do not and Ive had those ones for 3 years now...
customer_reviews.author: Some buyer

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, but didn't have the crisp sounds and the deep bass. Good as a hand-free talking device, but the sound quality, in my opinion was not too good. My son's Paul George ear buds blow this away on sound quality, but it doesn't have a mic.
customer_reviews.author: Jmen777

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earbuds specifically because they were advertised as sweat proof and made to fit in your ear without falling out during activity. It turns out neither of these claims hold true. I tried a couple of the bud varieties, and some definitely worked better than others, but I still had to keep putting them back in my ears after falling out. The left ear bud stopped functioning after a few weeks. At that point, I was stuck with only one functioning earbud and noticed that the volume on the right earbud was slowly getting lower as well. I contacted JLab via e-mail and still haven't received a response!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Thevervelil

customer_reviews.title: average
customer_reviews.text: Got these as stocking stuffers, they were a bit hard to adjust correctly and one set had only one working ear bud. Overall OK for the price ( they were on sale)
customer_reviews.author: TBP

customer_reviews.title: Already Broke
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use these very much at all since I was too busy with school to go work out. The right ear bud already doesn't work. I'm really disappointed in these and won't be ordering another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Pippa Runs

customer_reviews.title: Here is a great pair
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service and awesome earbuds! I had an issue with my first pair (one side wasn't working) so I contacted the seller, they quickly shipped another set and I returned my first set. These work great for running and most types of exercise. The malleable wiring allows easy sizing for your ears for comfort and the sound is very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Avoid These Headphones
customer_reviews.text: This product was very disappointing. I had to assemble them when I received the package and when I was able to put them together, the sound quality was awful. Please do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and no noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I got these earbuds because they are water/sweat-proof and I use them exclusively at the gym. Despite having ear wrap-arounds, they don't stay in very well. And the flexible things are too stiff to really fit well. Additionally, they provide almost no noise cancellation so when I'm at the gym, the gym music is still perfectly audible over the earbuds. I've had a lot of silicone earbuds like these and these block sound the worst by far.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Blosser

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these from my husband for use at the gym as he kept complaining that the skull candy ear buds he had kept falling out. He was looking for some wrap around ear buds but wasn't having any luck locally, unless he wanted to spend $50-$70. So far he really likes them and says they work great!
customer_reviews.author: T. Rhoads

customer_reviews.title: Good while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: As many have pointed out, after a while a headphone will go out. I've filed a warranty claim, I believe the problem lies in the fact that they let you shape them so freely, which will eventually break the wires. Still a good buy, I'll just try a different approach next time.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality JLab is pretty decent and they work well enough for mowing the ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't fit my right ear properly so has a tendency to loose the seal especially when sweating. I have this problem with most in ear headphones however at least until I found the Sennheiser CX685. Sound quality JLab is pretty decent and they work well enough for mowing the lawn, just not so well when running.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R. Stahle

customer_reviews.title: Quality product...
customer_reviews.text: ...For three months. The microphone has completely stopped working, just outside the return policy. I honsetly loved this headset, as it worked perfectly for when I was running or working out, which is why it is such a disappointment that they don't work properly anymore. The only reason I don't give the set a one-star rating is that the sound is still fine and the inline pause still works. Otherwise these would be way too chintzy for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoying fit
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is nice but it's a hard fit. You have to bend the ear rest perfectly and hope the buds stay in. It's annoying having to go through so much to put them on
customer_reviews.author: KEE L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for working out.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to wear while walking and running, so far work well. Sound quality is decent and they are easy to bend to fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: W in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: it has been working great. It fits well around the ear and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Most users have mentioned the sweat issue (slips when you sweat while running) and that is true but other than that, it has been working great. It fits well around the ear and the sound quality is not bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Puneet

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but they'll work.
customer_reviews.text: The description makes it seem as if you're buying extraordinary headphones. These are worth maybe $15 or $20 at most. I sat on mine and it snapped part of the aux part off. They are not high quality in sound or use. They do come with the ability to extend longer or stay short. They also have a range of ear piece sizes included. Other than that, they aren't amazing or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, don't stay in ear as expected
customer_reviews.text: Sound is exceptional for price, but problem keeping them in my ears when running. Worked their way out about 2.5 miles in.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Im sorry but the sound quality is not the same as the other jlab headphones i have bought but the only difference is the addition of a mic,would not have thought adding a mic would drastically change the sound, its sound is muddled and distorted at times i think i have made a bad choice. All other headphones from Jlab that i have bought were excellent
customer_reviews.author: Rgerm2

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit my ears
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that it would fit my ears and be a better quality product than the ones I already had...I was wrong. Waste of money I haven't used them since the 1st day that I tried them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M.

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: Had these less than a month and the left ear failed and I only use them at the gym! Returned them for a replacement. Replacement came and in just a few days started having intermittent sounds and harsh cracking! Returned them for a refund. Have since purchased the JLab Epic and so far so good and the sound is much better by far, but waiting to see how they hold up, I will definitively write a review on them when they make it past 60 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Sound was good but that is irrelevant if they don't stay on ...
customer_reviews.text: They will no longer hold their shape, this causing them to fall off during workouts. Sound was good but that is irrelevant if they don't stay on your head!
customer_reviews.author: Mittenman

customer_reviews.title: I recommend very well prepared for the sport very well by ...
customer_reviews.text: I recommend very well prepared for the sport very well by the magnificent price compared to ptros very good choice I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LULLABY LAKOTA

customer_reviews.title: FIT Earbuds are Unfit
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes that these would fit comfortably and stay in my ears while running. From day one it's been nothing but a time wasting act of frustration trying to shape the wire to my ear and start my run. When it takes 10 minutes before a workout just to try and get my earbuds to stay put, it's a failed design. I want to slap them on and be on my way! Now I only wear them while watching movies on my ipad.
customer_reviews.author: S. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Took me three pairs, but I finally got them
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are excellent, and they are quite resilient to my workout routine. However, the first pair I received had a technical issue with it, I returned them for another pair, and the second had the same exact error. They sent me a third pair and those finally worked, and I really enjoy them. Customer service was excellent, I just wish it didn't take three tries.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Warner

customer_reviews.title: sounded great when it lasted
customer_reviews.text: sounded great when it lasted, but after a couple months the right side no longer worked, returned for full refund
customer_reviews.author: texasmadge50

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit - Terrible Sound
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to be wonderful head phones...I kept thinking that I was crazy but honestly the sound it tinging at best. While its clear and the volume is good, the bass is completely missing! The fit took some time but now its great and I love all the options they gave including cord length...just wish the sound was better. I am still debating, because well I need a pair of head phones...but I am pretty sure these are going back.
customer_reviews.author: K.Dale

customer_reviews.title: 6 months of use-now worthless
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in Nov of 14. Yesterday (May 12, 2015) the left ear bud stopped working. I played with it and it came back on, then off again...back and forth the last two days with the ear bud not working, then working, back on, cuts off etc...I only used them with my ipod on my train ride to and from work so they were lightly used. 21 bucks plus tax down the toilet....
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Harden

customer_reviews.title: These are the worst set of headphones I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst set of headphones I have ever purchased. They are difficult to get in your ear, and once in, they refuse to stay in. If you're only going to use them for commuting purposes they might be ok, but if you are going to use them as your primary exercise headphones stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I get these because I do a lot of running and I figured they would be great (sweatproof) Wrong! Within the first week the left earbud lost sound, next couple of days no sound at all. I submitted a warranty replacement. I do gotta say they shipped me some new ones in 3 days (5 stars for that). So I get my new ones thinking everything would be good now, wrong! a day after the right earbud lost audio again! My advise looking for something else. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: The sound is great however I'm having trouble getting them to stay behind ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great however I'm having trouble getting them to stay behind or in my ear as I'm running very frustrating other than that Amazing sound!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that you have good sound and different sizes of cushion tips with these earbuds. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Rosario

customer_reviews.title: 1 Month of Use - Only 1 Ear Bud Works
customer_reviews.text: They were great until the right ear bud stopped working. I read other reviews that said the same thing but I bought them anyway. Let my mistake be your guide.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Don't get hookwinked!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to wear these earbuds for a few days and I'm not pleased with them. They fit awkwardly and feel uncomfortable. I bought them because I thought they would be tailor fit to my liking. Yes they are flexible but they feel as if they will fall out any second. I had to hold the actual bud pieces in my ear to get enough suction for decent sound. Never had this issue with regular ear buds or standard hook ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Mason

customer_reviews.title: Decent earphones, control doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The earphones themselves are fine. The bendable wire bit works relatively well, and I'd generally be pretty happy with these except that the controller doesn't do anything with my iPhone. There is only a single button; so - no volume control. Also, it doesn't seem to be able to access Siri - all it does if I push and fiddle with it long enough is pause the music. Yeah, that's something, but not what I expected. FWIW, sound is okay - I'll use these on indoor equipment where I can just access controls on my phone. Back to the search for the ideal earphone.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Not good for weight lifters
customer_reviews.text: There is an on/off switch in the cable that sits right below the clavicle. When I rack the barbell, it compresses the switch and kills the sound. The buds have acceptable sound quality and very good noise cancelling properties. But, if you don't lift heavy barbells, then you won't have any problem with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Blue

customer_reviews.title: good value.  base is good.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good compared to my motorola sf200. Does work with android phone for the one button control. Seem to be sweat proof.
customer_reviews.author: Qi Li

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Earbuds arrived and it looked like the package had been opened before and they don't even work! Imagine- you wait for your new earbuds and you put them on for a run and you can't hear a thing. What a waste of money! ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Lissa

customer_reviews.title: My hubby loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My hubby runs, and he loves these ear buds! Very comfortable, and washable if he sweats on them. great by and they stay in while he runs.
customer_reviews.author: LiliRoze

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know that I'll ever find the perfect ear buds, but these are a pretty good match. Good for the gym. Like the different sizes of rubber for the ear pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Gowan

customer_reviews.title: reasonably good sound, but ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked OK as ear buds, but I couldn't get them to "mold" to my ear and stay in place while I exercised. Had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: EEWoos

customer_reviews.title: i am picky about my earphone, and these were just OK.
customer_reviews.text: were not sweat proof and they didn't stay in my ears
customer_reviews.author: Tory lupinetti

customer_reviews.title: great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds for the price. Work fantastic. Only drawback is it takes a little bit to adjust around the ear but great for working out.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt W. Fioretti

customer_reviews.title: Good product, a little difficult to get used to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, a little difficult to get used to but worth the effort. A unique design, would be nice if a case came with them - no standard earbud holders/cases fit.
customer_reviews.author: David Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think these sound too good. When there is sweat on them then they dont work well,.
customer_reviews.author: Paul lifeisgood

customer_reviews.title: A lot in the package for the $ spent
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 of these as stocking stuffers for family this Christmas. Good product, multiple ear tips, customizable fit for the ear loop. Full sound (not tinny) - won't beat studio headphones, but great for wearing during workouts (no noticeable cord noise when moving around) or shutting out noise at the office. Yes, it takes some to get the fit just right, but once you do, they stay put.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality but doesn't stay I'm ears very well. I don't have problems with standard ear buds and these fall out a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin L

product_meta.title: JLab Audio FIT Sport Earbuds, Sweatproof and Water Resistant with in-Wire Customizable Earhooks - Black
product_meta.description: Finally. True wrap-around ear buds -designed with fitness top of mind. Work it out. Running. Biking. Climbing. The FIT's adjustable, built-in ear hooks ensure a comfortable and secure fit -no matter what you're taking on. The unique 45-degree-angle jack leverages the strength of pure metal with the durability of strong, flexing rubber. Even better, the lightweight cable is reinforced with Kevlar for optimum flexibility and strength. It's ready for you. Everything-proof. Blood. Sweat. Tears. And whatever else you can dish out. The FIT are 100 percent splash-proof, sweat-proof and washable. Total comfort. It's sleek. It's refined. And it delivers an unprecedented level of comfort. Engineered housing ergonomics provide a refined fit with a smooth, satin-soft feeling -right inside your ears. The FIT includes four pairs of soft, silicone cushions in a full range of sizes A modular cable with a detachable clip guarantee a secure fit. Titan of sound. Deep, rich bass. Full, luscious Mids. Crisp, vibrant highs. The FIT's titanium micro-drivers pack the punch for an incredibly smooth and consistent response across the entire frequency curve. Performance is enhanced via 24-karat gold-plated 3.5 mm jacks for premium, lossless connection. Exotic finish. Inspired by Italian supercars, eye-catching insets adorn the rear chrome grill that house the rear bass ports -all for an optimal mix of airflow to the drivers. Crafted from solid aluminum and polished with a silky, scratch-resistant anodized finish, the FIT is just as easy on the eyes as the ears.
feature_bullets: Built-in Ear hook, Designed to FIT You
100 Percent Sweat Proof, Splash Proof & Washable

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.8 out of 5 stars399 ratings2.8 out of 5 stars
